required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Performance Evaluation of Two Daily Disposable Toric Lens Designs in Habitual Soft Contact Lens Wearers
clinical_study.official_title: Performance Evaluation of Two Daily Disposable Toric Lens Designs in Habitual Soft Contact Lens Wearers

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to compare the clinical performance of two different daily disposable, SiHy toric contact lens types, Lens A and Lens B, in existing soft lens wearers when worn for one week each.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, bilateral eye, double-masked, randomized, 1-week cross-over, daily-wear design involving two different daily disposable toric lens types. Each lens type will be worn for approximately one week, during which participants record their subjective lens-wear experience.

primary_outcome.description: Ease of overall lens handling for putting on eyes, removing from eyes, and opening packaging will be measured on a 0-10 integer scale (0=Very difficult, 10-Very easy)

secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity will be measured using LogMAR scale in high room illumination: distance (â‰¥4m)

arm_group.description: daily disposable soft contact lens - test lens Subjects will be randomized to wear test lenses for one week and then cross-over to control lenses for one week.
daily disposable soft contact lens - control lens Subjects will be randomized to wear control lenses for one week and then cross-over to test lenses for one week.

intervention.description: daily disposable soft contact lens - test lens
daily disposable soft contact lens - control lens

overall_official.affiliation: Centre for Ocular Research and Education
